ratings.comment: Good choice for an ethnic studies credit. I found her easy to approach to ask questions about content and curriculum both through email and in person. There are 5 papers that are 3-4 pages in length but the prompts were about content that was covered in class. The content can be interesting and the workload is very manageable.

Easy ethnic studies class to take. Lectures are boring but mandatory for your grade. 5 papers and no exams. The final is online and short response with open notes, textbook and everything. As long as you put effort in you should get an A.

Although Shannon's lectures are occasionally boring, she is very effective at describing the material. Overall, this class is an easy-A as long as you show up to class (for the tophat questions) and do well on discussion-questions/essays. The final is online, and mirrors many of the questions on the discussion-questions throughout the semester.

If you are taking AMERIND100, keep in mind that she focuses this class on contemporary Indian issues. I went in thinking that it was going to be more focused on culture and history. It's an easy A. Leave your MAGA gear at home, this course carries a strong left-wing perspective.
Very nice professor, knows a lot about the topic. Six papers that are 3-4 pages throughout the semester, but not graded harshly. Only test is the final.

You have to do a ton of textbook reading and qs each week, but the final is the exact same qs and is online w/ open notes. There are also SIX short (3-4pg) papers, which is the only reason I disliked the course. They are not graded harshly, but I hateeee writing. Overall I would highly recommend Sparks, and this is probably the easiest ethnic class

I really like Prof. Sparks. She's great at describing what Native Americans have suffered through over the course of U.S. history/today. The class gets a bit political at times, but that happens in all college classes. There's 6 papers (really easy topics), as well as  an open book/notes/WKSTs final, along w/ some readings. For sure take.
Amazing professor. 6 papers, 6 sets of discussion questions to turn in, and a final.

This class is a lot of reading, you technically don't have to do it every night but finish before the assigned date, there are no midterms, 6 papers, and a final. She is very passionate. This class focuses on all of the bad things Native Americans have had to go through, there is nothing positive :/. Its not about their culture at all really..

She is the best professor Ive had at Madison! Her class is pretty straight forward and honestly I learned more in that class than any other. If you do the homework, readings and papers you will get an A. Take this class if you can.
Lectures are long and dry. Sparks is nice and a lenient grader, most people came out with an A.
Super great. Best class of all time. Every single student got an A

She is very clear in lectures and makes the material fun and engaging. If something isn't clear she is more than willing to meet with you after classin her office hours to clarify. Very supportive teacher.
Awesome class, awesome instructor! There is no textbook, all readings are provided to you.
Lectures are boring, class is not too hard.  Lots of reading.  Says "umm" and "ya know" so much I want to leave
